title: Samsung Exynos 7420 performance 20% up on 20nm chips | Trusted Reviews
description: ![]()### Alexa’s new whisper mode rolls out in US today – here’s how to enable it](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/how-to-enable-alexa-whisper-mode-echo-3607478 "Alexa’s new whisper mode rolls out in US today – here’s how toenable it")  * **Related:** [Samsung Galaxy Note 5 release date, rumours, news, specs, andprice](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/samsung-galaxy-note-5-release-date-rumours-news-specs-and-price)We recently had a chance to test the Snapdragon 810 chip on a test handset viathe AnTuTu benchmark.What’s interesting is that [the benchmark score turned out to behigher](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/snapdragon-810-antutu-results-qualcomm-out-powers-galaxy-s6-chip) for the 810 than the [leaked AnTuTubenchmark](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/samsung-galaxy-s6-edge-benchmark-reveals-record-performance) scores purported to be from the GalaxyS6, which would indicate that Snapdragon chips haven’t quite been usurped bythe Exynos series just yet.The report also confirms that the Exynos 7420 will be an octa-core chip that,when paired with the fact it will run a Mali-T760 GPU, should be a worthycontender for 2015 mobile chip glory.We’re expecting the Exynos 7420 to land in both the Galaxy S6 and Galaxy S6Edge, tipped to launch on March 1 at Mobile World Congress in Barcelona.
